bundleable.description: Check this box to include the file in a bundle.If you include this file in a bundle, clearing this box does not remove the file from the bundle. If you want to remove the file from a bundle, you have to update the bundle and remove the file.
bundleable.name: bundleable

department.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when Make Departments Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
department.name.name: department.name

description.description: Enter a description for this file. This description appears on the file record only.
description.name: description

folderType.value.description: The Type field automatically populates with the appropriate value for the folder selected. File Cabinet folders help to organize the files you use for different purposes. In most cases, when you create a subfolder, the Type is automatically set.If you are creating or customizing an SSP application subfolder, you may have the option to select a value for type. Note the following about the options available:    * Documents and Files - intended for storing documents and files for general use. SuiteScript files must be stored in the SuiteScripts folder or a subfolder thereof. The value for Type in SuiteScript subfolders are set to Documents and Files.    * SuiteCommerce Advanced Site Templates - intended for storing SSP application assets. Use this option for SSP application subfolders.
folderType.value.name: folderType.value

group.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
group.externalId.name: group.externalId

group.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
group.internalId.name: group.internalId

group.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
group.name.name: group.name

hideInBundle.description: Check this box if you want this file to not be viewable by those who install this file as part of a SuiteBundle.Note: You cannot hide Client SuiteScript in a bundle.
hideInBundle.name: hideInBundle

isInactive.description: Set to true if you want to inactivate this record. If set to true, this file or folder will no longer appear on lists.
isInactive.name: isInactive

isOnline.description: * Check this box if you want this file accessible externally. The file may be accessed with a URL that points to the file record.    * Clear this box if you want the file only accessible to those who are logged in to NetSuite with permission to view file cabinet documents.
isOnline.name: isOnline

isPrivate.description: Set to true if you want the documents and images in this folder to be seen by only you.
isPrivate.name: isPrivate

location.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.name.name: location.name

name.description: Enter a name for this file cabinet folder. You can use folders to organize the documents and images you store in your file cabinet.
name.name: name

parent.externalId.description: If this folder is a subfolder of another, set the parent folder here.
parent.externalId.name: parent.externalId

parent.internalId.description: If this folder is a subfolder of another, set the parent folder here.
parent.internalId.name: parent.internalId

parent.name.description: If this folder is a subfolder of another, set the parent folder here.
parent.name.name: parent.name

type.value.description: References a value from a user defined list at Lists > Relationships > Groups.
type.value.name: type.value
